answers.answer: Go with what you are comfortable with, and is healthy. If there is no reason health wise to induce, say no.
Yeah, he has to say that to protect his license. You should definitely not induce unless you are having complications. Let them monitor you closely, but stand your ground.
Thanks you guys! I will keep an open mind,  but i won't let them induce unless it's medically necessary

question: I am 30 weeks pregnant. My history is 1st pregnancy resulted in a still born at 28, had my daughter at 36 and my son at 34. All pregnancies i had preeclampsia.  I haven't been diagnosed with it this pregnancy,  however my doctor still wants to enduce at 36. He says because of my history. I do not want to be enduce that early, especially if im not having any complications. He said we can revisit the topic at my next appointment,  in which he plans on doing more test to see I'm i have preeclampsia. What should I do?
title: 30 weeks, i need your advice
